snippet: The number of new cases and deaths in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone rose by double-digit percentages in the past week, the World Health Organization reported.
abstract: World Health Organization reports that new cases and deaths from the Ebola virus outbreak in the West African countries of Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone have surged by double-digit percentages over past week; alarmed Ivory Coast border authorities block hundreds of Ivorian refugees in Liberia from returning.
lead_paragraph: The number of new cases and deaths in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone rose by double-digit percentages in the past week, the World Health Organization reported.

headline.main: Death Toll From Ebola Surges in West Africa, Prompting Alarm
